member.name: T:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder
member.summary: Holds a Graphics object together with (printer) device or bitmap that was used to create it, if any. The point is to dispose the device or bitmap together with the graphics when it is no longer needed (i.e. to avoid resource leaks).

member.name: F:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder.Empty
member.summary: An empty graphics holder instance.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder.FromDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a device context. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the device context are released (DeleteDC is called on the device context).
member.param: The device context from which graphics is created.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder.FromGraphics(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a graphics instance. When the holder is disposed, the graphics is left alone (i.e. NOT disposed).
member.param: The graphics to store in the new holder.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder.FromScreen
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from screen. If that fails (e.g. on Azure), the graphics is created from a bitmap. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the bitmap are released.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1PreviewClient.GraphicsHolder.FromBitmap
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a bitmap. The graphics and the bitmap are released when the holder is disposed. This should never fail.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.C1Combo
member.summary: The C1Combo control is used as a multicolumn drop-down list box.

remarks.para: C1Combo is independent of C1List, so it can be used alone or in conjunction with C1List. You can place a C1Combo control on a Visual Basic form at design time as you would a C1List control.
The C1Combo control also supports incremental search.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.PrintInfo.Print(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Saves the current grid to a stream in C1D (native C1PrintDocument) format.
Note that unlike most other print/export methods, this method does not require C1Report assemblies.

remarks.para: The stream's Position is set to 0 when the method returns.
This method does not show progress dialog (ignoring property).

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.PrintInfo.PrintToStream
member.summary:
Saves the current grid to a memory stream in C1D (native C1PrintDocument) format.
The stream's Position is set to 0 when the method returns.
member.returns: The stream containing the saved grid.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.PrintInfo.SaveAsC1d(System.String)
member.summary:
Saves the current grid as a C1D file, which can later be loaded into a C1PrintDocument (provided by C1Report product).
Note that unlike most other print/export methods, this method does not require C1Report assemblies.
member.param: The name of the output file.
member.returns: true if the file was successfully saved, false otherwise.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.PrintInfo.SaveAsC1d(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Saves the current grid to a stream in C1D (native C1PrintDocument) format.
Note that unlike most other print/export methods, this method does not require C1Report assemblies.
member.returns: true if the stream was successfully written, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Unlike the method, this method does not reset the stream's position after saving.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder
member.summary: This interface is used to allow objects and collection to serialize types of their members in a custom way. If a collection implements this interface, TypeToString is invoked during serialization of collection items, and for all items for which it returns a non-null string, that string is used as the element name of the item. If a class implements this interface, AND a member of that class has attribute TypeNameSerialization.Custom, AND does not have attribute XmlAttribute (i.e. is serialized as an element), TypeToString is invoked on the owner when that member is serialized, and if that returns a non-null string, that string is used as the value of TypeName attribute. When deserializing a collection which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked for each new item in the collection, and if that returns a non-null type, that type is used to create the item. Otherwise, TypeNameSerialization attribute is used. When deserializing a class which implements this interface, StringToType is invoked on that class for members with TypeNameSerialization.Custom attribute set.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.TypeToString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a string representing the type of the object

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.Util.Xml.Serialization.IMemberTypeEncoder.StringToType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the type restored from the serialized string

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.ComboStyleEnum.SimpleCombo
member.summary: Includes a text box and a list which is always displayed. The user can select from the list or type in the box. The size of a simple combo box includes both the text and list portions. By default, a simple combo box is sized so that none of the list is displayed. member.name: M:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.Rebind
member.summary: Re-establishes the connection with the bound data source.

remarks.para: This method re-establishes the connection with the bound data source, causing the control to perform the same operations that occur when you set the DataSource property at design time.
If you have not modified the list columns at design time, then executing the ReBind method will reset the columns, headings, and other properties based on the current data source.

To force the list to reset the column bindings even if the columns were modified at design time, invoke the method immediately before ReBind. Conversely, to cancel the list's automatic layout response and force the list to use the current column/field layout, invoke the method immediately before ReBind.

member.summary: Specifies if a user is allowed to create horizontal splits.

If False, then the user is prevented from splitting the list horizontally.

member.summary: Specifies if a user is allowed to resize the rows in the list.

remarks.para: This property determines whether a user is allowed to resize rows individually, all together, or not at all.
This property only works when the SelectionMode property is set to CheckBox.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.AllowColMove
member.summary: Enables/disables interactive column movement.

remarks.para: If True (the default), the user can move columns.
If False, the user cannot move columns.
Use the AllowColMove property to control whether the user can move columns by dragging the column header to the desired location. Any change in column order causes a event.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.AlternatingRows
member.summary: Determines if a list or split displays odd-numbered rows in one style and even-numbered rows in another.

remarks.para: If True, the OddRowStyle and EvenRowStyle properties control the appearance of rows within the specified object.
If False (the default), the Style property controls the display of rows within the specified object.
At design time, you can change the colors and fonts used to render odd (even) rows by modifying the built-in OddRow (EvenRow) style using the Styles property page.
At run time, you can change the colors and fonts used to render odd (even) rows by modifying the Style object returned by the OddRowStyle (EvenRowStyle) property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.AddItemSeparator
member.summary: Determines the separation string for columns when using the AddItem method in AddItem mode.
member.remarks: This property takes ; as the default value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.Bookmark
member.summary: Returns or sets the bookmark identifying the current row in the list.

remarks.para: Use the value returned by the Bookmark property to save a reference to the current row that remains valid even after another row becomes current.

When you set the Bookmark property to a valid value in code, the row associated with that value becomes the current row, and the list adjusts its display to bring the new current row into view if necessary.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.CaptionStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the appearance of the caption area.
member.remarks: This property sets or returns the Style object that controls the appearance of a C1List control's caption bar or a Split object's heading area. By default, this is the built-in Caption style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.CellTips
member.summary: Determines whether the list displays a pop-up text window when the cursor is idle.

remarks.para: The CellTips property determines whether the list displays a pop-up text window when the cursor is idle. By default, this property is set to NoCellTips, and cell tips are not displayed.

If the CellTips property is set to either Anchored or Floating, the event will be fired whenever the list has focus and the cursor is idle over a list cell, record selector, column header, split header, or list caption. The event will not fire if the cursor is over the scroll bars.

The setting Anchored aligns the cell tip window with either the left or right edge of the cell. The left edge is favored, but the right edge will be used if necessary in order to display as much text as possible.
The setting Floating displays the cell tip window below the cursor, if possible.

If you do not provide a handler for the FetchCellTips event, and the cursor is over a list cell, the default behavior is to display a text box containing the cell's contents (up to 256 characters). This enables the user to peruse the contents of a cell even if it is not big enough to be displayed in its entirety. You can also program the FetchCellTips event to override the default cell text display in order to provide users with context-sensitive help.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.CellTipsDelay
member.summary: Determines the amount of time before the cell tip window is displayed.

remarks.para: Setting this property to zero does not disable cell tips, but restores the default value of 500. To disable cell tips, set the CellTips property to NoCellTips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.CellTipsWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the width of the cell tip window.

remarks.para: The CellTipsWidth property returns or sets the width of the cell tip window in terms of the coordinate system of the list's container.

By default, this property is set to zero, which causes the cell tip window to grow or shrink to accommodate the cell tip text. You can override this behavior and give the cell tip window a fixed width by specifying a non-zero value for this property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.DeadAreaBackColor
member.summary: Controls the background color of the dead area in the list.

remarks.para: Setting this property will affect the appearance of the "dead area" of under populated controls, such as the area to the right of the last column, the area below the last data row, and the Outlook Grouping area.

If the property is True, the empty data rows it creates are not considered part of the "dead area" and will not be displayed in the DeadAreaBackColor. If you wish for the area occupied by the empty rows to be shown in the DeadAreaBackColor, you should first set the property to False.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.DefColWidth
member.summary: Specifies column width for auto-created columns.

remarks.para: Setting the DefColWidth property at run time does not affect existing columns, only those that are subsequently created in code.

In bound mode, some data sources do not provide text field widths when requested by the list. Therefore, if DefColWidth is 0, the actual column widths may not be what you expect since the list must supply a default width.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.DestinationCol
member.summary: Indicates which list column will be the destination after cell movement.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.DestinationRow
member.summary: Indicates which list row will be the destination after cell movement.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.DestinationSplit
member.summary: Indicates which list split will be the destination after cell movement.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.EmptyRows
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines how the list displays rows below the last data row.
member.remarks: If all of the records in the data source do not fill up the entire list, setting EmptyRows to True will fill the unpopulated list area with empty data rows. If EmptyRows is False (the default), then the unpopulated list area will be blank and will be filled with the system 3D Objects color (or the system Button Face color) as determined by your Control Panel settings.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.EvenRowStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the Style object that controls the appearance of an even-numbered row.

remarks.para: This property sets or returns the Style object that controls the appearance of an even-numbered row in a list or split where the property is set to True. By default, this is the built-in EvenRow style.
To change the appearance of odd-numbered rows, set the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.RightToLeft
member.summary: When True, applies right to left text functionality.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.ExtendRightColumn
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the last column will extend to fill the dead area of the list.
member.remarks: If the columns in the list dont take up all of the space available, then there is an area which is exposed. This area is called the dead area and has a default back color of gray. This property sets whether this area is to be filled with the last column of the list.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.FetchRowStyles
member.summary: Specifies whether the event will be fired.

remarks.para: If True, the event will be fired whenever the list is about to display a row of data.
If False (the default), the event is not fired.

Set this value to True when you need to perform complex per-row formatting operations that can only be done using the event. For example, if you want to apply fonts and/or colors to all rows that satisfy certain criteria, then you need to set the FetchRowStyles property to True and write code for the event.
To display every other row in a different color or font, you can simply set the property to True.

remarks.para: If True, partial rows are not displayed, and the height of the control will be reduced to eliminate the last partial row if necessary.
If False, partial rows are displayed, and the control retains its design-time height.

member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the appearance of an odd-numbered row.

remarks.para: This property sets or returns the object that controls the appearance of an odd-numbered row in a list or split where the property is set to True. By default, this is the built-in OddRow style.
To change the appearance of even-numbered rows, set the property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1List.ListBase.C1ListBase.PartialRightColumn
member.summary: True if rightmost column can be clipped to the edge of a split.

remarks.para: If True (the default), the rightmost column will be clipped if the control or split is not wide enough to accommodate the entire column.
If False, the rightmost column will not be clipped while other columns are visible. In this case, the rightmost column must be scrolled into view as the only visible column in the control or split.
If a control contains multiple splits, then setting its PartialRightColumn property has the same effect as setting the PartialRightColumn property of each split individually.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.MatchEntryEnum
member.summary: Determines how a C1List control performs searches based on user input.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchEntryEnum.None
member.summary: The default. The control does not perform any incremental searches.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchEntryEnum.Standard
member.summary: The search argument is limited to one character, and the control attempts to find a match for the character entered using the first letter of entries in the list. Repeatedly typing the same letter cycles through all of the entries in the list beginning with that letter.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchEntryEnum.Extended
member.summary: The control searches for an entry matching all characters entered. The search is performed incrementally as characters are typed. The search argument is cleared when the user presses Backspace or hesitates for a few seconds.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum
member.summary: Determines where the search is performed.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.DisplayMember
member.summary: Search the column of the DisplayMember.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.CurrentMousePos
member.summary: Search the column under the mouse cursor.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.CurrentSelectedCol
member.summary: Search the current selected column.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.LeftVisibleCol
member.summary: Search the left most visible column.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.RightVisibleCol
member.summary: Search the right most visible column.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchColEnum.AllCols
member.summary: Search all the visible columns.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum
member.summary: The comparation methods while searching the column.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.LessThan
member.summary: Used to search for strings, numbers and dates that are less than the stated value.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Used to search for strings, numbers and dates that are less than or equal to the stated value.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.Equal
member.summary: Used to search for strings, numbers and dates that are equal to the stated value.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: Used to search for strings, numbers and dates that are greater than or equal to the stated value.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.GreaterThan
member.summary: Used to search for strings, numbers and dates that are greater than the stated value.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.PartiallyEqual
member.summary: The PartiallyEqual is the default mode, which is the same as incremental search

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.MatchCompareEnum.IncludeEqual
member.summary: Used to match a string inside another string.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the UI behavior for selecting rows and columns.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum.None
member.summary: The user cannot select rows.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum.One
member.summary: Only one item in the list can be selected.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum.MultiSimple
member.summary: If the user clicks a row, that row is selected, and the SelectedIndex property returns a bookmark for that row. If more than one row is selected, the SelectedIndex property returns the bookmark of the most recently selected row, and the SelectedIndices collection contains the bookmarks for all selected rows. The user can also unselect a row.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum.MultiExtended
member.summary: Pressing Shift and clicking the mouse or pressing Shift and one of the arrow keys (Up Arrow, Down Arrow, Left Arrow, or Right Arrow) extends the selection from the previously selected item to the current item. Pressing Ctrl and clicking the mouse selects or deselects an item in the list. Since selected rows do not have to be adjacent, the user can also operate the vertical scroll bar to bring other rows into view if desired.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1List.SelectionModeEnum.CheckBox
member.summary: The user can select or unselect rows by clicking checkboxes.
